docs.snippet: After lengthy investigations, officials also believe that a hacking of Democratic emails was aimed at disrupting the election rather than electing Mr. Trump....
docs.lead_paragraph: After lengthy investigations, officials also believe that a hacking of Democratic emails was aimed at disrupting the election rather than electing Mr. Trump.
docs.abstract: Law enforcement officials say investigation into Russian interference in presidential election has found no conclusive or direct link between campaign of Donald Trump and Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin's government; FBI officials believe even hacking of Democratic emails was meant merely to disrupt race, not tilt it in favor of Trump.

headline.main: Investigating Donald Trump, F.B.I. Sees No Clear Link to Russia
headline.print_headline: Investigating Trump, F.B.I. Sees No Clear Link to Russian Government

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton’s reaction to the F.B.I. director has echoes in the response to Kenneth W. Starr, the independent prosecutor who spent years investigating Bill Clinton’s administration....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton’s reaction to the F.B.I. director has echoes in the response to Kenneth W. Starr, the independent prosecutor who spent years investigating Bill Clinton’s administration.
docs.abstract: News Analysis; Hillary Clinton's response to announcement by FBI director James B Comey that agency will review additional emails related to her use of private server recalls way she and former Pres Bill Clinton reacted to investigation by Kenneth Starr in 1998.

headline.main: For the Clintons, Two Investigations, One Protective Reflex

docs.snippet: Grandmothers — abuelas, in Spanish — are at the front lines of the Democratic Party’s effort to get Hispanic voters to the polls in Arizona, Nevada and Colorado....
docs.lead_paragraph: Grandmothers — abuelas, in Spanish — are at the front lines of the Democratic Party’s effort to get Hispanic voters to the polls in Arizona, Nevada and Colorado.
docs.abstract: Abuelas, or grandmothers, are on front line in efforts to push eligible voters in Hispanic-American community to get to polls on Election Day; Democrats court 'abuela vote' as way of leveraging special relationship and influence older women have in Hispanic families and communities.

headline.main: How Do You Say ‘Vote for Clinton’ in Spanish? Ask the Abuelas
headline.print_headline: How Do You Say ‘Vote for Clinton’ in Spanish? Just Ask the Abuelas

docs.snippet: With just a week to go and the race for the White House tightening, Hillary Clinton — with help from President Barack Obama — unleashed a fresh offensive Tuesday against Donald Trump and his vulgar comments about women. Trump strove to...
docs.lead_paragraph: With just a week to go and the race for the White House tightening, Hillary Clinton — with help from President Barack Obama — unleashed a fresh offensive Tuesday against Donald Trump and his vulgar comments about women. Trump strove to blend a quieter, presidential tone with his usual tough rhetoric, warning that a Clinton victory would "destroy American health care forever."

headline.main: Race Tightening, Clinton Revives Trump-Women Issue
headline.print_headline: Race Tightening, Clinton Revives Trump-Women Issue

docs.snippet: Low gas prices and President Barack Obama's high approval ratings are key factors that favor Democrat Hillary Clinton winning the White House in next week's election, according to a model from Moody's Analytics that has accurately predicted the la...
docs.lead_paragraph: Low gas prices and President Barack Obama's high approval ratings are key factors that favor Democrat Hillary Clinton winning the White House in next week's election, according to a model from Moody's Analytics that has accurately predicted the last nine U.S. presidential contests.

headline.main: Moody's Analytics Election Model Predicts Clinton Win
headline.print_headline: Moody's Analytics Election Model Predicts Clinton Win
